```diff
@@ -5,4 +5,13 @@
    return twMerge(clsx(inputs))
  }
+ 
+ export function slugify(text: string): string {
+   return text
+     .toLowerCase()
+     .trim()
+     .replace(/[^\w\s-]/g, '')
+     .replace(/[\s_-]+/g, '-')
+     .replace(/^-+|-+$/g, '')
+ }
  
  
```

</details>

</tool-use>

---


All changes are complete.

## Summary of Changes:

1. **Hero buttons now configurable in Sanity Studio:**
   - Added `showPrimaryButton` and `showSecondaryButton` boolean fields to the hero schema
   - Updated `HeroConfig` type to include these fields
   - Updated the Hero component to conditionally render buttons based on these flags (defaults to `true` if not set)

2. **Header navigation updated:**
   - Changed "Solutions" to "About" in the header
   - Updated the link to point to `#why-it-matters` (which links to the "Why it Matters" content section)

3. **Content sections now have IDs:**
   - Added a `slugify` utility function to convert titles to kebab-case IDs
   - Updated the Content component to automatically generate IDs from section titles
   - This allows the "Why it Matters" section to be linked via `#why-it-matters`

In Sanity Studio, you can now toggle the "Show Primary Button" and "Show Secondary Button" options in the Hero section to control visibility. Both default to `true`, so existing content won't break.

All linter checks passed. The changes are ready to use.

   - **Get Involved**: Community, Join the Community, Insights, Contact

   - **Legal**: Privacy, Terms, Code of Conduct, Accessibility
4. **Footer links**: Use Next.js `Link` for internal routes and anchor links
5. **Copyright**: Updated to "© 2025 AIDFest"

The footer now reflects the community event and links to relevant sections of the site. All links use the generated section IDs from the content titles.

+   const formatTimeAgo = (dateString: string) =&gt; {
+     const date = new Date(dateString)
+     const now = new Date()
+     const diffInSeconds = Math.floor((now.getTime() - date.getTime()) / 1000)
+ 
+     if (diffInSeconds &lt; 60) return "Just now"
+     if (diffInSeconds &lt; 3600) return &#96;${Math.floor(diffInSeconds / 60)} minutes ago&#96;
+     if (diffInSeconds &lt; 86400) return &#96;${Math.floor(diffInSeconds / 3600)} hours ago&#96;
+     if (diffInSeconds &lt; 604800) return &#96;${Math.floor(diffInSeconds / 86400)} days ago&#96;
+     return date.toLocaleDateString()
+   }
+ 
+   return (
+     &lt;main className="min-h-screen"&gt;
+       &lt;Header /&gt;

+                   : undefined
+                 
+                 return (
+                   &lt;Card
+                     key={post._id}

All changes are complete.

## Summary

### 1. **Made all section buttons/links editable in Sanity**

Added URL fields to all sections with buttons in the Sanity schema:
- **Hero Section**: `primaryButtonUrl` and `secondaryButtonUrl`
- **Community Section**: `buttonUrl`
- **Insights Section**: `buttonUrl`
- **CTA Section**: `buttonUrl`

In Sanity Studio, editors can now set:
- Full URLs (e.g., `https://example.com`)
- Internal routes (e.g., `/insights`, `/community`)
- Page sections (e.g., `#why-it-matters`, `#community`)

### 2. **Updated Components**

All components (Hero, Community, Insights, CTA) now:
- Read URL values from Sanity
- Use Next.js `Link` for internal routes (`/path` or `#section`)
- Use regular anchor tags for external URLs
- Default to sensible fallbacks if URLs aren't set

### 3. **Created Community Page**

Created `/app/community/page.tsx` similar to the insights page that:
- Shows all community posts/events
- Displays author avatars, timestamps, reply counts
- Highlights featured posts
- Has a "Back to Home" link

### 4. **Updated Footer**

Updated the footer to link to `/community` instead of `/#community`.

All changes are complete and linted. Users can now edit button links directly in Sanity Studio.

The URL/link fields are in the schema. In Sanity Studio, they appear when editing each section:

1. Go to Homepage Content
   - Open Sanity Studio at `http://localhost:3000/studio`
   - In the sidebar, click "Homepage Content"

2. Open a section
   - Click a section (e.g., "Hero (Top Banner)")
   - Expand its settings

3. Link fields by section:
   - Hero: "Primary Button Link" (`primaryButtonUrl`) and "Secondary Button Link" (`secondaryButtonUrl`)
   - Community: "Button Link" (`buttonUrl`)
   - Insights: "Button Link" (`buttonUrl`)
   - CTA: "Button Link" (`buttonUrl`)

---



---


The link/URL fields are in the schema. In Sanity Studio, they appear when you edit each section.

## How to Find the Link Options in Sanity Studio:

1. Go to Homepage Content
   - Open `http://localhost:3000/studio`
   - Click "Homepage Content" in the sidebar

2. Open any section (Hero, Community, Insights, or CTA)

3. You'll see the link fields right after the button text fields:

   **Hero Section:**
   - Primary Button Text
   - **Primary Button Link** ← URL field
   - Secondary Button Text
   - **Secondary Button Link** ← URL field
   - Show Primary Button
   - Show Secondary Button

   **Community Section:**
   - Button Text
   - **Button Link** ← URL field

   **Insights Section:**
   - Button Text
   - **Button Link** ← URL field

   **CTA Section:**
   - Button Text
   - **Button Link** ← URL field

These fields accept:
- Internal routes: `/insights`, `/community`
- Page sections: `#why-it-matters`, `#community`
- External URLs: `https://example.com`

If you don't see these fields, refresh the Studio or check that you're editing the correct section type. The documentation has been updated to include this information.
